questions.question: I didn't go to the party .................... I was feeling a bit tired.
questions.description: The conjunction because indicates the reason for something.

questions.question: Do you know the reason ...................... she is angry with me?
questions.description: After reason we use that or why. Because is not used after why.

questions.question: She had ...................... many children that she didn't know what to do.
questions.description: So...that is a conjunction. Too and very cannot be followed by that-clauses.

questions.question: We send them weekly reports ........................... they may have all the information they need.
questions.description: The conjunctions so that and in order that are used to talk about purpose. So that is more common in an informal style.

questions.question: Send the parcel express ...................... they get it before Monday.
questions.description: We use so that to indicate purpose.

questions.question: Do you know a shop ................. they sell used cameras?
You may borrow my car ........................ you drive carefully.
questions.description: All of these conjunctions are used to state conditions.

questions.question: ........................ we go by bus or train, it will take at least 3 hours.
questions.description: We can use whether ... or as a double conjunction. Its meaning is similar to 'it doesn't matter whether...or'.

questions.question: Why is he looking at me ......................... he knew me?
questions.description: The conjunctions as if and as though mean the same.

questions.question: ..................... some people insist that smoking should be banned, others disagree with that view.
questions.description: We use while to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: I am going out ....................... I have brushed my hair.
questions.description: We use as soon as to suggest the idea that one event happens immediately after another.

questions.question: No sooner had I closed my eyes, ................... the telephone rang.
questions.description: Sooner is a comparative word. It is followed by than.
